definition:
An AbstractEntity whose state evolves according to deterministic or
   stochastic rules over time (discrete or continuous), in some state
   space (e.g. activation space, concept manifold, policy parameters).
opposite_reasoning: While 'StaticEntity' or 'TimeIndependentEntity' would be stronger semantic opposites, they likely don't exist in the ontologies. ConstantQuantity is the best available option that captures the core opposition: DynamicalSystem evolves over time with changing states, while ConstantQuantity represents values that remain fixed. This opposition is semantically meaningful for Fisher-LDA (dynamic/evolving vs constant/unchanging) and likely exists in SUMO. For AI safety monitoring, distinguishing between dynamic processes and static constants could be useful for detecting behavioral changes vs baseline properties.
